line.en: 'Hurry up!'
'There's no need to rush.'
I had just finished checking out, and left the\nconvenience store to catch up to Kotori, who had\nleft first with a bag on her lap.
I grabbed the wheelchair's handlebars.
'Let's go, Kotori! Hold on tight!'
'Aaaalright, goooo!'
At Kotori's signal, I pushed the wheelchair as\nfast as I could.
'Huff... puff... huff... puff...'
'Hey, are you okay?'
'I'm... okay! I'm fine!'
I try to act tough, but I can't hide the fact\nthat I'm out of breath.
'Haa... haa... My stamina's gotten worse...'
I've been running with the wheelchair this far\nbut my stamina isn't what it used to be.
She couldn't help but notice, so Kotori took a\nsports drink out of the bag.
'Here, Aoi.'
'Thanks...'
'You're getting a bit carried away... is your\nknee okay?'
'My knee? Yeah, no problem. ...I think.'
According to the doctor, I shouldn't have any\ndifficulty with everyday life.
The problem is whether or not this is above the\nlevel of everyday activity.
'I told you halfway that you could stop, but you\nran all the way to school...'
I'm in a good mood, and have been since this\nmorning.
Our club activities are finally about to start.
It's Saturday, a day off, but we got up early and\ncame to school.
'...You went through all the effort to get\nbetter, so take care of yourself, okay?'
'You're right.'
I finish talking, and take a drink.
I've been sweating a lot, so my body quickly\nabsorbs the sports drink.
'What about your knee?'
'Pfooo! ...Cough, cough!'
Ageha came out of nowhere, and stood right next\nto me.
'It-It's nothing, no big deal.'
'Hmm.'
'Morning, Kotori.'
'...M-...Morning Ageha.'
Kotori seems a little embarrassed as Ageha talks\nto her.
'You got here first?'
'Nope. I saw you guys racing along at top speed\nand I followed you.'
Oh? I didn't notice.
'That's the first time I've seen someone running\nand pushing a wheelchair.'
'...Aoi, I'll go on ahead, okay?'
Kotori was being careful around Ageha, and spoke\nuncomfortably as she went on ahead.
Instead of being annoyed, she seemed more\nembarrassed than anything.
I think Ageha understands that too, but...
'Aoi?'
'...What?'
'Oh, nothing. Well, I'm going ahead too.'
'See you, Aoi.'
Seeming like she'd had enough of talking to me,\nAgeha also went on ahead.
'Hey, wait, Ageha.'
I chase after the two of them, and we head to the\ngarage.
'Wassup!'
Amane was already inside the garage.
Amane was making a serious face in front of the\ndrawing board.
She's really concentrating, and hasn't noticed\nus.
For a moment, I wasn't sure if I should call out\nto her. But if we don't say anything, how many\nhours would she be doing that?
'Hi there, Amane!'
'It's you guys...'
'Wassup, Amane?'
'Wassup.'
'W-...Wassup.'
Ageha and Kotori copy me.
'From now on, we'll do our best!'
Amane points at me, and makes a troubled face.
'You there, what's your name?'
That's right, I'd never once told her my name...
Even though we've met several times.
'Aoi Minase, second year, class A!'
I give a very sharp self-introduction, and the\nothers do likewise.
'Also from second year, Class A, Ageha Himegi!'
'A-Also from second year, Class A, Kotori\nHabane...'
'Aoi... Ageha... Kotori... Aoi...\nAgeha...Kotori...'
She memorizes our faces, and names in order.
'I'm from fifth year, Class C... or was it D?\n...Amane Mochizuki.'
She misses so many lessons that she apparently\ndoesn't even know which class she's in.
'Thanks for yesterday. Because of you guys... I\ncan continue to stay here.'
We're somehow very grateful to hear these words\nof thanks from Amane.
'Is it really alright for us to join?'
She wasn't sure if she would accept new members.
Had she found the 'answer' she was looking for,\nthen?
'Oh, yeah. You're all welcome.'
'Welcome to the Soaring Club.'

I don't know what she was worrying about, or how
she arrived at her answer. But, it somehow seemed
that there was no problem with us joining the
club.
'Umm... Well then, let's do our best.'
She said that like she was just throwing it out\nthere, before returning to the drawing board.
She stares at the diagram with a serious look on\nher face.
'Amane?'
'Hmm? Yes?'
'...What should we be doing?'
'Oh, that's right. Make yourselves at home, have\na cup of tea.'
'There are some manga on that shelf too.'
On 'that shelf' was every volume of Slam Dunk.
The covers were faded, and it seemed like they'd\nseen many years of 'service'.
The two girls both make faces that say 'This\nisn't what I thought it would be like.
My face might have been the same.
'Isn't there anything for us to do?'
'I told you, read some manga...'
'Not that, something to do with the glider!'
'We really want to get involved with the glider!'
Amane opened her eyes wide.
'...Really? You guys are weird...'
I don't wanna hear that from you...
'Um, Amane. Could it be that... we're in your\nway? By joining the club?'
She didn't want anyone coming near this garage,\ndid she?
'No, that's not true! It's just... that...'
'I've been doing this by myself until now, so I\ndon't know what you can do.'
When Amane was a step away from the national\nchampionship with the Robotics Club, it seems she\ndid most of it by herself.
'(She's the type with no social skills.)'
'(You're one to talk.)'
'Excuse me, can I ask a question?'
Ageha raised her hand.
'Go ahead.'
'What activities are this club involved in,\nspecifically?'
Ageha asks a fundamental question.
I feel like she's been asked a similar question\nbefore, but then, she was only asked for a\nsummary.
If we're actually going to take part in this\nclub, we need more specific information.
'Well, ah... We make gliders and fly.'
That's it.
I think everyone knows that already.
'Making or flying, which is the main objective?'
'...After building it, then you'd fly it. Isn't\nthat what normally happens?'
'But you're not aiming to enter competitions, or\nanything, are you?'
'No, I'm not.'
She answered bluntly, and without even a shred of\ninterest.
'So, the main objective is to build it then?'
'No, that's wrong. Flying above the clouds is the\nobjective, right?'
Amane somehow lacks confidence when she nods.
'How far have you gotten with the glider?'
'A few days ago, I finally finished assembling it\nand went for a test flight, but...'
As Amane explains, she moves into the garage.
'The main wings snapped.'
In the corner of the garage lay the broken wings.
'It looks like they weren't strong enough. Now,\nI'm reviewing the designs, but...'
Looking at the twisted wings, Amane lets out a\nlittle groan.
'I've redone the strength calculations, but this\ntime, I can't find where the problem is.'
'I don't know why this happened, so it's a\nproblem...'
If Amane doesn't understand, there's no way we\nwill.
I thought to myself as Ageha moved close to\nAmane, and checked the broken parts of the main\nwings.
Then...
'Yep, this'll snap,'
she stated simply.
'How do you know that??'
'See here...? The thickness is uneven, and it's\ndistorted in places.'
'Oh yeah, it is...'
'The construction methods are too rough. The\njoints couldn't withstand the load and it\ncracked.'
Amane reels in shock.
'Is that what it was...?'
And then...
'It's because I'm not very good with my hands...'
She becomes timid.
'You made this by hand, piece by piece?'
'I didn't do it all myself, but... The fuselage\nis handmade.'
'...This... is handmade?'
Kotori and I were pretty surprised by this, but\nAgeha didn't seem to make much of a big deal\nabout it.
'It's too rough... It's too rough...'
This is bad, she's totally depressed.
'Because of the parts Aoi got, I was able to fix\nthe malfunction in the instruments.'
'If I can just get the main wings repaired, it\ncan go on another test flight.'
'Are you going to do the wing repairs by hand\ntoo?'
'Yeah, of course.'
Ageha takes a part of the wing that isn't\nsnapped, and looks it over, with a troubled look\non her face.
'Wouldn't it be better to rebuild the wings from\nscratch?'
'If you don't, then other parts might snap too,\ny'know.'
'Sniffle sniffle...'
Amane looks like she's about to cry.
'Alright then, we'll help.'
'This is fiber-reinforced plastic, right? I've\nworked with this before. I might be able to do\nsomething with this.'
'We should start right away. That way, we can fly\nit sooner, right?'
The three new members' motivation has returned,\nand now we're getting excited.
'I really want to do that too. But,\nunfortunately, there aren't any materials.'
'There are lots of parts that can be used for\nrepairs...'
'To make something of this size from scratch\nwould require a large amount.'
'How do you usually get things like that?'
'Mail order.'
Amane goes to the laptop and navigates to the\nwebsite that sells her materials.
'To remake the main wings, we'd need about this\nmuch,'
said Amane as she entered a number.
'Ack! That's not a bad price, but there's no way\nwe can afford it on the club's budget...'
I don't know how much the budget is for the\nSoaring Club, but the price displayed on the mail\norder site was no small amount.
'Hmm. Well, that's no problem.'
Click.
Amane submitted the order.
'Is that okay, Amane?'
'Hmm? Yeah, that amount of money should be no\nproblem at all.'
Whaddya mean, 'no problem'? Could it be that when\nit comes to the club budgets, the Soaring Club\ngets preferential treatment?
'It'll take a little while for it to arrive. Then\nwe can get started.'
Which means that we don't have anything to do\nnow, after all.
'Until then, what should we do?'
'...Read some manga or something.'
With that order, the Soaring Club President went\nback to staring at the designs she was working\non.
Even if we say we've got nothing to do, it's not\nlike there's nothing whatsoever for us to do.
We were still beginners when it came to gliders,\nso we took some books from the shelf and started\nour own little study session.
Aerodynamics, glider construction, and so on.
As for the basics on how aircraft fly, we were\ntold that before by Amane.
In terms of the various methods of creating what\nis known as 'lift', the more we found out, the\nmore interesting it became.
And then, it was noon...
'Mmmmm, that's tasty! That was the first intake\nof calories I've had in a while!'
Amane was already enjoying the bread and rice\nballs that Kotori and I bought at the convenience\nstore this morning.
'Just wondering: How long has it been since you\nlast ate?'
'Hmm... 46 hours ago. That time, it was a pork\ncutlet bowl from the cafeteria! I had a big\nbowl!'
'Would you like to eat this too...?'
Out of pity, Kotori offered Amane her pickled\nplum rice ball.
'Oh, thanks.'
'She has quite an appetite, doesn't she?'
Witnessing the 'Amane Mochizuki style eating\ntechnique' for the first time, Ageha is, as\nexpected, pretty freaked out.
It could be because the image of the 'beautiful\nand mysterious senpai' that Ageha had been\nholding onto was being completely annihilated.
By the way, because we had club activities this\nmorning, Ageha brought a lunchbox.
'Are there any other parts we need?'
I asked Amane once she had calmed down after her\nmeal.
'Only one.'
'What is it?'
'I can't get one no matter what I do. The truth\nis, it's a big problem.'
From the way she said it, we all crowd around to\nlisten intently to her story.
'What is it you need?'
'A pilot.'
Shing!
When Amane said this, she made a dramatic face\nshe would use if this were on TV, looking\nstraight at the camera.
'Aren't you going to fly it?'
'You flew it the other day!'
'I'm not very good though. Also, last time, I\nalmost botched the landing, and damaged the\ntail.'
'It's true. The tail has scratches on it.'
'I don't have much confidence in my motor\nskills.'
'...Hang on, could you come here for a second?'
I call Amane over to an open space.
'Please try to do some repeated side jumps.'
'Oh, okay.'
Amane tried some repeated side jumps, like I\nasked.
'Hup, haa, hup...haa...'
'Amane, it's repeated side jumps, y'know?'
'Y-... Yeah, I know! Hup, haa... ugh... whoa...'
It's supposed to be repeated side jumps, but each\ntime, the distance is different and sometimes she\nturns her body.
It should be just moving quickly from side to\nside, but it looks like some kind of horrific\ndancing.
'It's true, she's terrible...!'
Without thinking, we all murmured in unison.
It didn't seem that motor skills were that\nimportant for piloting a glider, but that level\nof clumsiness could make things pretty dangerous.
'Also... hup, haa... I have acrophobia.'
'When I go to high places, I get scared and feel\ndizzy.'
Then why the hell is she making a glider?
'But I'm qualified. You only need one document.'
In other words, she's been trying really hard.
'Oh, that's enough of the repeated side jumps.'
'Phew... I'm worn out.'
Amane wipes the sweat from her forehead. She's a\nbeautiful girl, so at least she's able to do\nthose kinds of movements well.
'Me, me, me!'
Suddenly, Kotori raised her hand.
'I want to do it! I want to be the pilot!'
As Kotori vigorously volunteered, Amane made a\ntroubled face.
'...I'm sorry, but you can't do it.'
'Why not...?' If I need to practice, I'll try\nreally hard. I might not look like it, but I've\ngot great motor skills.'
'You can't push the rudder pedal though, can\nyou?'
'Rudder pedal...?'
There are pedals in the cockpit.
If you can't push them, you can't pilot it.
Kotori moved back, dejected.
'Well, I'd rather not do it. I'm more interested\nin making it than flying.'
Ageha, who is looking inside the aircraft's\ncockpit, sounds like she's talking about someone\nelse.
That leaves one person.
'I wanna do it.'
If it's motor skills we're talking about, I'm\nfairly confident.
'Alright, it's decided. Aoi, you will undergo\ntraining to become the pilot.'
'Yes!'
And that's how I suddenly became the pilot.
After club activities were over, I returned to\nthe dorm.
'C'mon, cheer up.'
'What? I am cheerful.'
Ever since it was decided that I'd be the pilot,\nKotori's been feeling down.
'Just because you can't pilot it, doesn't mean\nyou can't fly.'
That glider is a double-seater.
There are two types of glider cockpit,\nsingle-seater and double-seater.
Obviously, the single-seater fits one person,\nwhile the double-seater fits two.
'Once I'm able to fly, you're the first person\nI'm taking with me.'
'It's irritating how it feels like you're looking\ndown on me...'
'...but, I'll settle for that.'
'Good. Alright, let's get ready for dinner.'
'Hello, we're back!'
I push the wheelchair through the doorway.
'Welcome back, Aoi, Kotori-chan!'
'Hello.'
'Kanako, thanks so much for yesterday.'
'No, no, I'm glad it went well. I wanted to soar\nto the heavens too, though...'
'By the way, Kotori, she's here.'
'Kotori-chaaaaaaaaaaaan!!!!!!!!'
Fwoosh!
'Aargh!'
As we entered the dining hall, with the force of\nthe Saint Bernard from the other day, an unknown\ngirl came flying out to hug Kotori.
'I'm sorryyyyy!! I'm sorry that I couldn't come\nback to see yoooou!!!'
Kotori's big sister burst into tears as she held\nher and rubbed her cheeks against hers.
'Hold on... uh... that... that hurts! Hibari...\nlet go!'
'Okay... sniffle.'
Realizing that she was suffocating her little\nsister, she let go of Kotori.
'Who's she?'
'She's my big sister...'
Kotori introduced us brusquely in a way that\nimplied, 'I don't like doing introductions.
'Sis, this mean-looking boy is... well, he\ndoesn't really look that mean but he's violent\nand karate chops me...'
'Yeah, yeah, hurry up with the introduction.'
'He's our new dorm mother.'
'Nice to meet you, I'm Aoi Minase, the current\ndorm manager.'
I bowed my head, and Kotori's sister quickly\nstood up, and straightened out her messed up\nclothes.
'Sorry for the late introduction, I'm Hibari\nHabane. Kotori's older sister.'
She seems very proud to say that she's Kotori's\nolder sister.
'I heard there was a new dorm mother, so I\nthought I should meet you as soon as possible.'
'But I've been away from Japan due to my job for\na while...'
'This is nothing special, but please share it\nwith everyone.'
She gave me a deep bow, and passed me something\nin the wrapper of a famous Japanese sweets shop.
'Thank you very much.'
I was surprised at first, but she seems like a\nperfectly sensible person.
She's gentle and seems like a nice... a little\ndifferent from her little sister.
'What did you buy?'
'Sweet bean jelly from Mifune. Also, there's some\nice cream in the fridge.'
'Alright! As expected of my big sis!'
Kotori rushes straight to the fridge.
'You can eat that after dinner!'
'It's fine, just one spoonful!'
'No.'
'Tch... mean as always.'
'Ha ha ha, Kotori looks like she's having such a\ngood time! I had no reason to worry...'
'Oh, that's right, Kotori!!'
While Kotori had the fridge open and was\nrummaging around inside, her sister went over to\nher.
'I was so happy to see you that I completely\nforgot!'
'Are you serious about quitting school!?'
'Not so loud!!'
There are other boarders outside the dining hall.
'Why do you want to quit? Did something bad\nhappen?'
'If so, I'll speak to your teacher...'
'I'm not going to quit anymore.'
'...I still haven't completely made up my mind,\nthough. I'm going to keep trying for a little\nwhile longer.'
'I see...'
Hibari breathes a sigh of relief.
'Kotori, when you said you wanted to quit school,\nwhile I was away, I kept worrying and\nworrying...'
'I'm sorry for worrying you like that.'
'No, that's okay...'
Oh yeah, she said just now that she was working\naway from Japan.
Kanako said before that her sister hadn't been\nhere for a while, but that was why?
'Where did you go?'
'On an overseas business trip. She's fluent in\nGerman, Spanish, and Swedish.'
I don't really get it, but that's amazing!
'I was against it, but the company ordered me to\ndo it...'
'She was only studying foreign languages as a\nhobby.'
'If it meant that I couldn't see Kotori, I\nthought that it might be better to quit the\ncompany.'
'No, that would be going too far, sis...'
'No, not really.'
'Actually I was supposed to be back tomorrow, but\nI was so worried that I was at my wit's end and\ncame back a day early!'
she said while clinging onto Kotori.
'So, what really happened? Tell me everything!'

'I-...It's fine now. It's no big deal, it was
like the 'May blues' that people usually get a
month after the start of the school year, but it
came two months late.'
'Sniffle'
Hibari looked at me with tearful eyes.
She was trying to say that if I knew anything, I\nshould spill the beans.
'Umm... I think that everything's okay with\nKotori.'
'Today, she went to do club activities even\nthough we had a day off from school.'
'Club activities?'
'We're in the Soaring Club. Right, Kotori?'
'Soaring Club? What's that?'
'Umm... It's...'
'Have you heard of gliders? Well, it's like an\nairplane. It's used to fly through the sky.'
'The sky...'
'No, that's not it, Hibari! I'm not going to fly.\nOr rather, I can't fly.'
'I was told just today that I couldn't do it!'
As Kotori desperately tries to cover it up, she\nsignals me with her glaring eyes.
'Th-That's right! We don't just fly, we build\ngliders and stuff!'
I don't really know why, but I follow her lead.
'Really...?'
'Yeah. So don't worry.'
Hibari looked like she'd accepted it for the time\nbeing, and didn't pursue the issue any further.
Kotori seemed relieved. It seemed like there was\nsome reason why she shouldn't be doing club\nactivities.
'Anyway... sniff, sniff... Something smells\ngood!'
Just now, a smell that stimulated my hunger\nstarted drifting through the air.
'I've been making paella! I was taught how while\nI was away.'
'There's enough for everyone, so please, enjoy.'
Hibari's home cooking was superb.
Paella is Spanish style cooked rice with shrimp\nand shellfish. It was quite refined, so it went\ndown really well with everyone in the dorm.
Also, after the main course was dessert: sweet\nbean jelly from a famous Japanese sweets shop. It\nwas perfect.
Apparently, Hibari had been visiting Flying Fish\nManor since a while back, and had been making\nfood for Kotori and the other boarders.
Since Kotori is disabled, Hibari had been given\nspecial permission to come help at any time by\nthe owner and caretaker.
Thanks to her, the level of satisfaction with\ntonight's dinner was exceptionally high.
'Whew, I'm full!'
'You seem very familiar with Hibari.'
At the dinner table, Hibari was very open with\nnot only her sister, but with all of the other\nboarders.
'Hmm? Yeah, you're right.'
'Since Kotori is like that, she takes care of her\nas her big sister, doesn't she?'
I guess that when she says 'like that', she's not\ntalking about her disability, she means her\npersonality.
'And she always buys souvenirs for everyone.'
'She's got such a cute little sister, she can't\nhelp but want to take care of her.'
While we speak, Hibari pushes Kotori and her\nwheelchair out of the dining hall.
'Thank you for the meal, Hibari.'
'It's nothing. I'll clean everything up later, so\nyou can just leave it there for now.'
Even though she had just gotten back from an\noverseas business trip, she's full of energy.
Despite her pretty and petite appearance.
'No, I can do that.'
'That's right. After having such a delicious\nmeal, you should do some work.'
She says it like it was all her doing.
Kotori must also be proud of her sister.
'Kotori, give me a hand later, okay?'
'Whaaaat...?'
'You ate that delicious food too, didn't you?'
'Hmph!'
For some reason, Kotori's reaction seems a little\ncuter than usual. It must be her sister's\ninfluence.
'Okay, before that, we're going to take a bath\ntogether.'
'And also, we'll be sleeping together tonight!'
'In separate beds.'
'Huuuuuh? Whyyyyy?'
'...Because it's really uncomfortable when you\nhug me when you're half asleep.'
'I was looking forward to that, which is why I\ncame back in such a hurry...'
Together with her sister, acting downhearted,\nKotori headed to the bathroom.
As I watch them leave like that, I remember that\nKotori was desperately trying to cover up that\nshe's in the Soaring Club just now.
'(It must be because her family would worry if\nshe were to do anything dangerous.)'
It seemed very unnatural to me, and it preyed on\nmy mind a little.
